# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `cd_all`
* Variable label: `History of Cardiac disorders`
* Variable description: `The participant has been diagnosed by one or more of the following conditions: angina, myocardial infarction, heart attack, coronary heart disease, congestive heart failure, heart murmur, valve disease`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | No, the participant has not been diagnosed of any of these conditions
1        | Yes, the participant has been diagnosed by any of these conditions

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing



<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "History of Cardiac disorders"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
datafolder <- "../RData/"
#sing_idlist <- c()
```

# Data process




## Cuba


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `PTOLDHRT` |`PHRTWHAT`|
|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `told had heart problem?` |`what was the heart problem?`|
| **Table name**  | `1066-Cuba-Baseline` | `1066-Cuba-Baseline` |
| **Categories** | `0 = no`<br/>`1 = yes` |`1 = heart attack`<br/>`2 = angina`<br/>`3 = heart failure`<br/>`4 = valve problem`<br/>`5 = other` |
| **Missings** | `NA` | `NA` |
| **Description** |  |  |

```{r assign cuba_w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_cuba_w1','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',variables=list('PTOLDHRT','PHRTWHAT'), missings = T)
t1066_cuba_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_cuba_w1')

```

```{r local cuba_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDHRT
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(t1066_cuba_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(t1066_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(PTOLDHRT))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- t1066_cuba_w1$PHRTWHAT
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(t1066_cuba_w1)[3])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(t1066_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(PHRTWHAT))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cd_all` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDHRT == 1 and PHRTWHAT == 1 or 2 or 3 or 4 or 5 into 1`
* `PTOLDHRT == 0 into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo cuba_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w1$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cd_all <- rep(999,length(t1066_cuba_w1$id))
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cd_all[which(t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_cuba_w1$PHRTWHAT %in% c(1,2,3,4,5))] <- 1
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cd_all[which(t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDHRT==0)] <- 0

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript cuba_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cd_all
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(cd_all))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation cuba_w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$cd_all)
X <- c(
  sum(t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDHRT==0,na.rm=T),
  sum(t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_cuba_w1$PHRTWHAT %in% c(1,2,3,4,5),na.rm=T)
)
BeforeH <- c(X[1:2],length(t1066_cuba_w1$id)-sum(X))
C <- rbind(AfterH,BeforeH)
colnames(C) <- c("0 -> 0","1&(1,2,3,4,5)->1","NA->999")
kable(C)

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cd_all` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `f_PTOLDHRT == 1 and f_PHRTWHAT == 1 or 2 or 3 or 4 or 5 into 1`
* `f_PTOLDHRT == 0 into 0`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo RM_w2}



# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RM_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_RM_w2$id)
t1066_ds_RM_w2$cd_all <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_RM_w2$id))
t1066_ds_RM_w2$cd_all[which(t1066_RM_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==0)] <- 0
t1066_ds_RM_w2$cd_all[which(t1066_RM_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_RM_w2$f_PHRTWHAT %in% c(1,2,3,4,5))] <- 1


```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript RM_w2, echo=F}

kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_RM_w2, aes(x=factor(cd_all))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation RM_w2, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(t1066_ds_RM_w2$cd_all)
X <- c(
  sum(t1066_RM_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==0,na.rm=T),
  sum(t1066_RM_w2$f_PTOLDHRT==1 & t1066_RM_w2$f_PHRTWHAT %in% c(1,2,3,4,5),na.rm=T)
)
BeforeH <- c(X[1:2],length(t1066_RM_w2$id)-sum(X))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("0 -> 0","1&(1,2,3,4,5)->1","otherwise->999")
kable(C)

```
